newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Prudential Singapore fund to double in year.
newsitem.headline: Prudential Singapore fund to double in year.

text.p: Prudential Assurance Company Singapore Pte Ltd is confident its policyholders' investment-linked funds will double to Singapore $1 billion over the next year, chief executive Tan Suee Chieh said on Thursday.
Tan told a news conference Prudential Singapore's current funds had taken four years to build to about S$500 million.
"I am generally confident that within the next 12 months we will expect to see equity, managed and cash funds pass the S$1 billion level," he said.
Prudential Singapore is a unit of London-listed Prudential Corp Plc.
Tan said future reforms to Singapore's Central Provident Fund (CPF), effective from January 1 1997, would be "a major contributory factor" in managed funds growth.

The reforms seek to harmonise the CPF Basic and Enhanced Investment Schemes, reducing the threshold at which individuals can invest surplus compulsory CPF deposits in alternative products to S$8,000 from the current S$50,000.
About 30 percent of Prudential Singapore's $500 million investment-linked portfolio currently comprises surplus CPF investments, said Tan.

Tan was speaking at a press conference to mark the first anniversary of the PruLink Equity Fund, a multiple option fund that invests in the Hong Kong, Thailand, Malaysia, Philippines, Indonesia and Singapore markets.
